title: Jittleyang or Fuhuhluhtoogan: The Meanings & Origins of the TikTok Slang

steps.title: A â€œjittleyangâ€ is a person known for being an attention grabber.
steps.content: A â€œjittleyangâ€ is a person known for being an attention grabber. According to Baltimore native, Richard Webster (also known as Bippleyipsnipp on TikTok), a â€œjikkleâ€ or â€œjittleâ€ means â€œan attention grabber.â€ The suffix â€œ-yangâ€ can be added to any word for extra flair, but it doesnâ€™t change the meaning. So, a â€œjittleyangâ€ refers to someone or something that grabs attention. [1] X Research source Although thereâ€™s no official pronunciation of â€œjittleyang,â€ most people pronounce it as â€œDJI-tul-yang.â€ However, the word is often spoken very quickly so that the middle syllable almost sounds like a glottal stop (similar to how a British English speaker might pronounce the double â€œtâ€ in â€œbutterâ€). Examples of how â€œjittleyangâ€ is used: â€œForget the jittleyangs and focus on your end goal.â€ â€œShe is such a jittleyang. All the guys hit on her at the club.â€ â€œThat red coat is a jittleyang, especially since people mainly wear black and neutrals.â€

steps.title: â€œFuhuhluhtooganâ€ might refer to someone who is good in bed.
steps.content: â€œFuhuhluhtooganâ€ might refer to someone who is good in bed. While no one knows the exact definition of the term â€œfuhuhluhtoogan,â€ some people believe it means that someone is good in bed. Similarly to â€œjittleyang,â€ â€œfuhuhluhtooganâ€ has no officially accepted pronunciation, but most users online pronounce it as â€œfuh-huh-luh-TOO-gihn.â€ Examples of how â€œfuhuhluhtooganâ€ is used: â€œI heard heâ€™s a fuhuhluhtoogan ğŸ˜â€ â€œNot to brag, but Iâ€™m positive Iâ€™m a fuhuhluhtoogan.â€ â€œAccording to the ladies, I am the definition of a fuhuhluhtoogan.â€

steps.title: Both terms come from Baltimore rapper and barber Richard Webster.
steps.content: Both terms come from Baltimore rapper and barber Richard Webster. In March 2021, Richard (also known by his rap name Bibbleyipsnipp) released a song called â€œCity Girls,â€ which features lyrics that are super hard to decipher. This was partly due to his Baltimore accent, which caused the song to be known as â€œThe Baltimore Accent Song.â€ The song went viral on TikTok in 2023, especially since Richard continued to post popular TikTok videos of him using other slang phrases. [3] X Research source TikTokers started to make funny videos about the sounds they heard in his rap, including â€œjittleyangâ€ and â€œfuhuhluhtoogan.â€

steps.title: The â€œAre you a jittleyang or fuhuhluhtooganâ€ meme went viral in 2024.
steps.content: The â€œAre you a jittleyang or fuhuhluhtooganâ€ meme went viral in 2024. In January 2024, TikTok user @_shawwtty posted a viral video of his little sister shouting, â€œAre you a jittleyang or a fuhuhluhtoogan?â€ to his mother. His mother looks super confused and keeps saying she doesnâ€™t understand what her daughter is talking about. Since then, some people have been identifying as either jittleyangs or fuhuhluhtoogans, making their own lore and backstories about what they are. [4] X Research source Example: TikTok user @foodplushistory posted a video in April 2024, claiming that the jittleyangs started a war with the fuhuhluhtoogans because they stole their eggs. In the game Angry Birds, the pigs steal the eggs from the birds, meaning the pigs are jittleyangs and the birds are the fuhuhluhtoogans.

steps.title: Bombastic Side Eye
steps.content: Bombastic Side Eye This is a sideways look that people give to express disgust or disapproval. If someone does (or says) something out of pocket, you can give them the bombastic side eye by staring at them out of the corner of your eye, without turning your face. Itâ€™s a simple way to show that youâ€™re judging them and that you donâ€™t agree with their opinion or behavior. [5] X Research source On TikTok, â€œbombastic side eye, criminal offensive side eyeâ€ refers to the trend of people uploading videos of themselves reacting to uncomfortable or cringe-worthy situations.

steps.title: Bouba and Kiki
steps.content: Bouba and Kiki Bouba and Kiki is a viral meme that actually comes from a linguistic concept where people intuitively connect certain sounds to specific shapes. One of the prime examples of this linguistic phenomenon is â€œboubaâ€ and â€œkiki.â€ Regardless of lingual and cultural background, people around the world were shown to associate the sounds â€œboubaâ€ and â€œkikiâ€ with a rounded or spiky shape, respectively. [6] X Research source In the early 2020s, â€œbouba or kikiâ€ became a viral meme on Twitter, Instagram, and TikTok. People began to use â€œbouba or kikiâ€ as a way to identify different objects, as well as to categorize their personality type. [7] X Research source For example, this tweet from user @Thinkwert placed two runway looks side by sideâ€”labeling one as â€œKikiâ€ and the other as â€œBouba.â€ You can even take online personality quizzes to determine where youâ€™re more bouba or kikiâ€”like this one from wikiHow.

steps.title: Broke Boyfriend Hug
steps.content: Broke Boyfriend Hug The â€œBroke Boyfriend Hugâ€ is a popular TikTok term that refers to the hug-from-behind position men stand in when their girlfriend pays for everything. This could be necessities like groceries or household supplies, but it also includes games, haircuts, or anything that isnâ€™t considered essential. [8] X Research source Oftentimes, a guy will use this move at the cash register when his girlfriend has pulled her card out to pay for him.

steps.title: Only in Ohio
steps.content: Only in Ohio The meme is often used to caption crazy, unfortunate, or apocalyptic videos and images of things that could only happen in Ohio. The state isnâ€™t actually that strange in reality, but social media users think itâ€™s a funny joke that bizarre things are happening in a state as random and mundane as Ohio. [10] X Research source The meme is also known as â€œOhio vs the Worldâ€ or â€œCanâ€™t have (X) in Ohio.â€
